result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn L Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 30 days granted.
Concurrent with: 14CF1258 and Count 2 of 14CM1949

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn L Ross

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: inmate communication letter from the defendant requesting that if there are any outstanding warrant he would like them to be ran concurrent with the sentence he is currently doing at this time.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 30 days  Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with 14CF1258 and Count 2 of 14CM1949.  Credit for 30 days.
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: January 30, 2015
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date and for case 14CF1258 to follow along for a sentencing after revocation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests further proceedings date.  Hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
